newsitem.title: CANADA: Interfor sees higher selling prices in Q4.
newsitem.headline: Interfor sees higher selling prices in Q4.

text.p: International Forest Products Ltd said on Tuesday it expected its sales prices to rise in the fourth quarter as the Japanese market continues to strengthen for both hemlock and Douglas fir structural building products.

"Western red cedar markets in the U.S. are also strong and are expected to continue their strength in the fourth quarter," the forest company said. But it added that it anticipated difficulty in reducing logging costs in the fourth quarter because of seasonally weak production.
"However log prices in most (tree) species have begun to increase including improvement in pulp log prices," it said.
The company announced it earned C$211,000 or C$0.01 a share in the third quarter compared to earnings of C$586,000 or C$0.02 a share in the same period of 1995.
